result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Cassi Nelson

Pre-trial conference on June 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

01:33 PM.  Clerk - CRHI. 
Defendant Ryan H Thomas in court in custody with attorney Nelson from Jefferson County Public Defenders Office - by video.  (SPD will appoint counsel.)   Public Service Special Prosecutor Atty. Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
By agreement, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient.

Court verifies that the name, address, DOB information on the Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited

Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $1,000.00 Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--no presence at any US Cellular location. 
--no possession of any personal identification information of any 3rd party. 
--booking at Jefferson County Sheriff's Department 
--appearance at the preliminary hearing date scheduled.
Recess 1:39pm

NEXT:   (Notices to be mailed.)
(1) Pretrial Conference on  6/15/22 at 9am
(2) Preliminary Hearing on 7/19/22 at 8:30am
